title: Sonoma County’s roots are showing at Gravenstein Fair
text:

Photo: Michelle Feileacan Sonoma County goes to its agricultural roots with the Gravenstein... Image 2 of 2 Sonoma County goes to its agricultural roots with the Gravenstein Apple Fair, where chefs apply their talents to the heirloom fruit and old-time contests, activities and demonstrations keep visitors busy all weekend.
Photo: Michelle Feileacan Sonoma County goes to its agricultural roots with the Gravenstein... Sonoma County’s roots are showing at Gravenstein Fair 1 / 2 Back to Gallery gallery_thumbs_close|article-gallery-6402581|article-gallery-6402581|0 gallery_overlay_close|article-gallery-6402581|article-gallery-6402581|0 Sebastopol’s Gravenstein Apple Fair puts the famous heirloom fruit at the heart of its old-time festivities in Ragle Ranch Park, starting with the chef’s tent and extending to darts games, a pie-eating contest and juggling. An Artisan Cheese Lounge offers seated pairings of cider, beer or wine with local cheese, and a Do-It-Yourself Arena tutors participants in the arts of making mozzarella, felting wool and herbal medicines, among other skills. Kids’ activities range from a hay maze to a youth circus, and live music will issue from two stages throughout each day.
Vitals: Aug. 8-9, 10 a.m.-
6 p.m. $15 adults, seniors/veterans $12, children (6-12) $10, 5 and younger free. Artisan Cheese Lounge $25 extra. Parking $5; free shuttles available from satellite locations. Discounted admission for cyclists. 500 Ragle Road, Sebastopol. (707) 837-8896. www.gravensteinapplefair.com.
Classic cars convene: More than 200 world-renowned collector cars and motorcycles congregate on the fairway of the Pebble Beach Golf Links’ surf-splashed 18th hole for the Pebble Beach Concours d’Elegance, closing out the Monterey Auto Week. Ferrari leads the classic car contest, while other special classes include prewar British sports cars, the 75th-anniversary Lincoln Continental and the 50th-anniversary Shelby Mustang. Aug. 16, 9 a.m.-5 p.m. General admission $300-$350. (831) 622-1700. www.pebblebeachconcours.net.
Palm Springs makes a splash: It should surprise no one that Palm Springs’ latest summer festival involves multiple swimming pools. Now in its third year, Splash House will take over the pool areas of the Saguaro Hotel, Hard Rock Palm Springs and the expanded Palm Springs Hilton. Ticket holders can shuttle between venues at will to relax, dance to popular regional bands and keep cool with regular dips. Aug. 8-9, noon to late night. $115 weekend pass; hotel packages available. (888) 833-1031, www.splashhouse.com.
